titleStmt.title: [Writ] 1793 July / Andrew Ewing: a machine-readable transcription of an image
titleStmt.author: Ewing, Andrew

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Special Collections Library, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text.

bibl.title: [Writ] 1793 July / Andrew Ewing
bibl.author: Ewing, Andrew
bibl.note: This document is a writ dated July 1793 and signed by Andrew Ewing. The writ orders James Cole to pay Howel Tatum the sum of 69 pounds, 14 shillings, and 4 pence half penny.
Special Collections Library, The University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN
Davidson County, Court of Pleas Quarter Sessions

projectDesc.p: Prepared for The University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

address.addrLine: Territory of the United Staets of America South of the River Ohio
To the Sheriff of Davidson County

div.p:
Whereas Howel Tatum Esqr. in our Court of pleas Quarter Sessions held for the County of Davidson April Term 1793 did by Writ of Original Attachment Recover Against James Cole Montflorence
Esqr. Esquire the Sum of Sixty nine pounds fourteen Shilings four pence half penny With the ?
Indorsed Endorsed As to us Appears of Record. Which Writ of Attachment Was Levied on the Remaining Ballance Balance of the One fourth part of Lick After Andrew Jackson is Satisfied,.... you Are therefore Commanded that you Expose to Sale Such Ballance Balance of the one fourth part of Neely Lick As Shall Remain After Satisfying the Judgment Obtained by Mr. Jackson, Or Otherwise, as the Circumstance of the Case may Require Cause to be made, Secured, Such Remaining
Ballance Balance
Aforesd. Aforesaid So that the Same may Apply Towards Satisfying to the
sd. said Tatum this Judgment Above Recited; And have you the Same before the Justices of over Couth of pleas and Quarter Sessions to be held for the County of Davidson at the Courthouse in the Town of
Nahsll Nashville
On the Second Monday in October next Ready to Render to the said Tatum Toward Satisfying his Debt Costs
Aforesd. Aforesaid fact not Witness Andrew Ewing Clerk of our said Court of Davidson at Office at
Nahsll Nashville on the Second Monday in July 1793
